metadata.title: CVE-2023-50868 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
The Closest Encloser Proof aspect of the DNS protocol (in RFC 5155 when RFC9276 guidance is skipped) allows remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice (CPU consumption for SHA-1 computations) via DNSSEC responses in arandom subdomain attack, aka the "NSEC3" issue. The RFC 5155 specificationimplies that an algorithm must perform thousands of iterations of a hashfunction in certain situations.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-50868` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libunbound8 - 1.19.1-1ubuntu1
python3-unbound - 1.19.1-1ubuntu1
unbound - 1.19.1-1ubuntu1
unbound-anchor - 1.19.1-1ubuntu1
unbound-host - 1.19.1-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

dnsmasq - 2.90-1
dnsmasq-base - 2.90-1
dnsmasq-base-lua - 2.90-1
dnsmasq-utils - 2.90-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: bind9 package in noble is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '1:9.18.24-0ubuntu1').
isc-dhcp package in noble is affected and may need fixing.
unbound package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.19.1-1ubuntu1').
dnsmasq package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.90-1').
pdns-recursor package in noble is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.9.3-1').
knot-resolver package in noble is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '5.7.1-1').
